info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 23 at 2:31PM PDT until August 25 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Abundant lightning on dry fuels is anticipated Thursday through Thursday night... .An upper level wave will move into the region from the south on Thursday and Thursday night. Thunderstorms are anticipated to pop up across the region with the most activity along the coast. The coast missed out on the rain from the remnants of Hurricane Hilary and the threat for new fire ignitions is highest in that location. Other locations across southern Oregon and northern California still have the potential to see thunderstorms Thursday through Thursday night. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 8 AM PDT FRIDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 280... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 5 PM Thursday to 8 AM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...A higher threat of lightning ignited wild fires. Any new ignitions may spread rapidly if storms are dry. * AFFECTED AREA...The western section of FWZ 280. This includes some fires within the Happy Camp Complex. * THUNDERSTORMS...Moving towards the north around 20 to 35 mph. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts up to 45 mph * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information.
